tags.title: param
tags.description:
If `true`, a close button will appear in the
  top right corner of the popup.
tags.name: options.closeButton

tags.title: param
tags.description:
If `true`, the popup will closed when the
  map is clicked.
tags.name: options.closeOnClick

tags.title: param
tags.description:
A string indicating the part of the Popup that should
  be positioned closest to the coordinate set via {@link Popup#setLngLat}.
  Options are `'center'`, `'top'`, `'bottom'`, `'left'`, `'right'`, `'top-left'`,
  `'top-right'`, `'bottom-left'`, and `'bottom-right'`. If unset the anchor will be
  dynamically set to ensure the popup falls within the map container with a preference
  for `'bottom'`.
tags.name: options.anchor

tags.title: param
tags.description:
A pixel offset applied to the popup's location specified as:
  - a single number specifying a distance from the popup's location
  - a {@link PointLike} specifying a constant offset
  - an object of {@link Point}s specifing an offset for each anchor position
 Negative offsets indicate left and up.
tags.name: options.offset

tags.title: param
tags.description: Space-separated CSS class names to add to popup container
tags.name: options.className

tags.title: param
tags.description:
A string that sets the CSS property of the popup's maximum width, eg `'300px'`.
 To ensure the popup resizes to fit its content, set this property to `'none'`.
 Available values can be found here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/max-width
tags.name: options.maxWidth

tags.title: example

Sets the geographical location of the popup's anchor, and moves the popup to it. Replaces trackPointer() behavior.

Tracks the popup anchor to the cursor position, on screens with a pointer device (will be hidden on touchscreens). Replaces the setLngLat behavior.

Sets the popup's content to a string of text.

node in the DOM,

Sets the popup's content to the HTML provided as a string.

This method does not perform HTML filtering or sanitization, and must be
used only with trusted content. Consider

if
the content is an untrusted text string.
